00020 // XSVF Player task
00021 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00022 portTASK_FUNCTION( XSVF_Player::MainTask, pvParameters )
00023 {
00024     (void) pvParameters;
00025 
00026     for(;;)
00027     {
00028         xsvf.MainLoop ();
00029         }
00030     }
00031 
00032 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 // Main loop of the XSVF Player task
00034 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 void XSVF_Player::MainLoop( void )
00036 {
00037 #ifdef TR_INFO        
00038     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00039     TRACE_INFO( "XSVF_Player Task\n" );
00040     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00041 #endif
00042 
00043     // Peek first XSVF byte and loop while it is EOF.
00044     // Note that xXsvfFirstByte byte will be later reused by the ReadXSVF()
00045     // when ReadXSVF() is called by xsvfExecute().
00046     //
00047     do firstByte = getc ();
00048         while( firstByte < 0 );
00049 
00050 #ifdef TR_INFO        
00051     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00052     TRACE_INFO( "Starting XSVF player (XSVF data peek 0x%02X)\n", firstByte );
00053     // TRACE_INFO( "Datap = %08X, Datac = %u\n", uint( datap ), datac );
00054     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00055 #endif
00056 
00057     // Reset CRC and byte count
00058     //
00059     crc = 0;
00060     byteCount = 0;
00061 
00062     // Elapsed time
00063     ulong dTimerStart = dTimerTick;
00064 
00065     // Start XSVF player
00066     //
00067     xsvfRC = xsvfExecute( traceLevel, parseOnly );
00068 
00069     long dElapsed = dTimerTick - dTimerStart;
00070 
00071     // Normalize CRC
00072     //
00073     crc &= 0xFFFF;
00074 
00075     // Signal that we have ended
00076     //
00077     sMsg.timeStamp = dTimerTick;
00078     sMsg.magicMSB  = XPI_MSG_MAGIC_MSB;
00079     sMsg.magicLSB  = XPI_MSG_MAGIC_LSB;
00080     sMsg.type      = XPI_IMSG_XSVF_END;
00081     sMsg.subtype   = 0;
00082     sMsg.data[0]   = xsvfRC;
00083     sMsg.data[1]   = ( crc >> 8 ) & 0xFF;
00084     sMsg.data[2]   = crc & 0xFF;
00085     sMsg.data[3]   = ( byteCount >>  24 ) & 0xFF;
00086     sMsg.data[4]   = ( byteCount >>  16 ) & 0xFF;
00087     sMsg.data[5]   = ( byteCount >>   8 ) & 0xFF;
00088     sMsg.data[6]   = ( byteCount >>   0 ) & 0xFF;
00089     sMsg.data[7]   = ( dElapsed >>  24 ) & 0xFF;
00090     sMsg.data[8]   = ( dElapsed >>  16 ) & 0xFF;
00091     sMsg.data[9]   = ( dElapsed >>   8 ) & 0xFF;
00092     sMsg.data[10]  = ( dElapsed >>   0 ) & 0xFF;
00093 
00094     usbOut.Put( NULL, 0, 1000 ); // Terminate previous message
00095     usbOut.Put( &sMsg, sizeof( XPI_IMSG_HEADER ) + 11, 1000 ); // Send this message
00096 
00097 #ifdef TR_INFO        
00098     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00099     TRACE_INFO( "XSVF completed; Bytes = %u, CRC16 = 0x%04X, Elapsed = %ld\n", 
00100                 byteCount, crc, dElapsed );
00101     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00102 #endif
00103 
00104     // CLEANUP:
00105 
00106     // Make xXsvfQueue empty
00107     //
00108     if ( datac != 0 )
00109     {
00110         datac = 0;
00111         semaEmpty.Release( 1 );
00112         }
00113 
00114     datap = NULL;
00115     firstByte = -1;
00116     
00117     // Mark player disabled
00118     //
00119     enabled = false;
00120     }
00121 
00122 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00123 // Start XSVF player
00124 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00125 void XSVF_Player::Enable( int trace_level, bool parse_only )
00126 {
00127     if ( enabled )
00128         return; // TODO: restart?
00129 
00130     // Reset FPGA
00131     //
00132     xpi.ResetFPGA ();
00133 
00134     // Configure parameters
00135     //
00136     traceLevel = trace_level;
00137     parseOnly  = parse_only;
00138     
00139     // Send end-of-transfer packet (flush usbOut)
00140     //
00141     usbOut.Put( NULL, 0, 1000 );
00142 
00143     // Start player
00144     //
00145     enabled = true;
00146     }
00147 
00148 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00149 // Wait at least the specified number of microsec.
00150 //
00151 // Use a timer if possible; otherwise estimate the number of instructions
00152 // necessary to be run based on the microcontroller speed. For this example
00153 // we pulse the TCK port a number of times based on the processor speed.
00154 // Example wroks for systems with TCK rates > 1 MHz.
00155 //
00156 // To calibrate timer, the best way is to send simple XSVF with single XWAIT instruction
00157 // and then measure elapsed time of the xsvfExecute() to excatly match XWAIT time.
00158 //
00159 // Sample XSVF data to XWAIT reset state in 10 seconds (folowed by XCOMPLETE): 
00160 // 17 00 00 00 98 96 80 00
00161 //
00162 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00163 
00164 void uSleep( long microsec )
00165 {
00166     // Note: Manually adjusted (with oscilloscope) to give 1 us per while loop
00167     // with 50% duty cycle of TCK on AT91SAM7S256 with flash wait state setting
00168     // AT91C_MC_FWS_1FWS: 2 cycles for Read, 3 for Write operations
00169     //
00170     while( microsec-- > 0)
00171     {
00172         SetTCK( 0 );
00173         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00174         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00175         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00176         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00177         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00178         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00179         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00180         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00181         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00182         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00183         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00184         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00185         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00186         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00187         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00188         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00189         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00190         
00191         SetTCK( 1 );
00192         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00193         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00194         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00195         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00196         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00197         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00198         asm volatile( "NOP" );
00199         }
00200     }
